p: M. villosa and P. amboinicus have rosmarinic acid (RA) as the majority compound in their ethanolic extracts. Studies related to photoprotective activity of this acid have showed a favorable future for this metabolite, since its photoprotective capacity has been observed, besides having good antioxidant activity and contributing to lipid peroxidation inhibition [ 36, 37, 38], which places it in a relevant position in the development of new sunscreens.
